page.title: 17Cammas Hall Farm Visit 2
page.content: The house is an early 15th Century Tudor house and we all noticed the massive Tudor chimnies. The farm is partly "Pick your own". Most of the fields have names like "Aunt's Garden" , "10 Acres", "Good Sheepfield","Short Alley" and "Long Alley". The farm has 412 acres, the average field size is 25 acres. Wheat is the main crop,but barley,oil seed rape, rhubarb, rasberries, strawberries, loganberries , gooseberries and are also grown. We were shown the old barn called the Tithe Barn. This is about the same age as the house. There is an old moat around the house, it has some ducks on it now. There is also a lilly pond containing many goldfish. Kingfishers have been seen near the pond but we weren't lucky enough to see them on our visit.
